content:
Hello, 

I recently checked my grades for Pset 1 and noticed that the auto-grader gave my part C a 0%. I was initially confused because my code produced the same answers the auto-grader expected so I went to office hours to try and understand what happened. I think the problem lies in the fact that I named the variable supposed to be named "r" as "guess" and "steps" as "attempts." When it checked for the correct "r" and "steps", it did not find it because my variables were under a different name. I completely didn't realize the variable names mattered, and had just renamed them to make it easier to track and understand when reading through my code. I will definitely make sure to name variables correctly in the future, but for now I was wondering if you would maybe consider looking back at my code and giving some or maybe all of the points back (provided it is correct, which I believe it is). Again, I will make sure to do it correctly in the future so I apologize for any trouble. Thank you so much!

Landon Dolvin
subject: Pset 1 Grading Issue

content: If you received a 0 on the pset, it will be manually graded by a TA. In the future, remember to read the pset instructions carefully!
